eula.title: Risk Notice
eula.description:
1. Your Xiaomi user information and device information will be stored in the Home Assistant system. **Xiaomi cannot guarantee the security of the Home Assistant storage mechanism**. You are responsible for preventing your information from being stolen.
2. This integration is maintained by the open-source community. There may be stability issues or other problems. When encountering issues or bugs of this integration, **you should seek help from the open-source community rather than contacting Xiaomi customer service**.
3. You need some technical ability to maintain your local operating environment. The integration is not user-friendly for beginners.
4. Please read the README file before starting.

5. To ensure stable use of the integration and prevent interface abuse, **this integration is only allowed to be used in Home Assistant. For details, please refer to the LICENSE**.

auth_config.title: Basic configuration
auth_config.description:
### Login Region
Select the region of your Xiaomi account. You can find it in the Xiaomi Home APP > Profile (located in the menu at the bottom) > Additional settings > About Xiaomi Home.
### Language
Select the language of the device and entity names. Some sentences without translation will be displayed in English.
### OAuth2 Redirect URL
The OAuth2 authentication redirect address is **[http://homeassistant.local:8123](http://homeassistant.local:8123)**. The Home Assistant needs to be in the same local area network as the current operating terminal (e.g., the personal computer) and the operating terminal can access the Home Assistant home page through this address. Otherwise, the login authentication may fail.
### Note
- For users with hundreds or more Mi Home devices, the initial addition of the integration will take some time. Please be patient.
- If Home Assistant is running in a Docker environment, please ensure that the Docker network mode is set to host, otherwise local control functionality may not work properly.
- The local control functionality of the integration has some dependencies. Please read the README carefully.

homes_select.title: Select Home and Devices
homes_select.description:
## Usage Instructions
### Control mode
- Auto: When there is an available Xiaomi central hub gateway in the local area network, Home Assistant will prioritize sending device control commands through the central hub gateway to achieve local control. If there is no central hub gateway in the local area network, it will attempt to send control commands through Xiaomi LAN control function. Only when the above local control conditions are not met, the device control commands will be sent through the cloud.
- Cloud: All control commands are sent through the cloud.
### Import devices from home
The integration will add devices from the selected homes.
### Room name synchronizing mode
When importing devices from Xiaomi Home APP to Home Assistant, the naming convention of the area where the device is added to is as follows. Note that the device synchronizing process does not change the home or room settings in Xiaomi Home APP.
- Do not synchronize: The device will not be added to any area.
- Other options: The device will be added to an area named as the home and/or room name that already exists in Xiaomi Home APP.
### Debug mode for action
For the action defined in MIoT-Spec-V2 of the device, a Text entity along with a Notify entity will be created, in which you can send control commands to the device for debugging.
### Hide non-standard created entities
Hide the entities generated from non-standard MIoT-Spec-V2 instances, whose names begin with "*".

 
### Hello {nick_name}, please select the integration control mode and the home where the device you want to import.

update_trans_rules.title: Update Entities Transformation Rules
update_trans_rules.description:
## Usage Instructions
- Update the entity information of devices in the current integration instance, including MIoT-Spec-V2 multilingual configuration, boolean translation, and model filtering.
- **Warning**: This is a global configuration and will update the local cache. It will affect all integration instances.
- This operation will take some time, please be patient. Check "Confirm Update" and click "Next" to start updating **{urn_count}** rules, otherwise skip the update.

update_lan_ctrl_config.title: Update lan control configuration
update_lan_ctrl_config.description:
## Usage Instructions
Update the configurations for Xiaomi LAN control function. When the cloud and the central hub gateway cannot control the devices, the integration will attempt to control the devices through the LAN. If no network card is selected, the LAN control function will not take effect.
- Only MIoT-Spec-V2 compatible IP devices in the LAN are supported. Some devices produced before 2020 may not support LAN control or LAN subscription.
- Please select the network card(s) on the same network as the devices to be controlled. Multiple network cards can be selected. If Home Assistant have two or more connections to the local area network because of the multiple selection of the network cards, it is recommended to select the one with the best network connection, otherwise it may have bad effect on the devices.
- If there are terminal devices (Xiaomi speaker with screen, mobile phone, etc.) in the LAN that support local control, enabling LAN subscription may cause local automation and device anomalies.
- **Warning**: This is a global configuration. It will affect all integration instances. Please use it with caution.
